text: (upbeat music)
- [Narrator] It's been 10 years

since Formula One first
introduced hybrid powertrains

and up until now we've been
unable to see how drivers

utilize this technology
to their advantage.

These highly advanced power
units recover electricity
from thermal and kinetic energy

to power the drivers outta the
corners and down the straits.
Introducing hybrid energy system,
a new F1 insight powered by AWS.

A new graphic for fans
identifies how drivers
use their electrical energy to get as much
out of their cars as they can.
The graphic will be able to identify three
different driver behaviors based
on the energy used on the previous lap.
Neutral, the driver balancing the amount
of energy harvested and used.
(car revving)
Recharging, the driver focusing
on boosting the battery level.
Deploying, the driver using more energy

in order to improve their
performance on track
either to defend or attack.

This is all achieved by solving
energy balance equations

using the immense cloud
computational power provided
by AWS, helping viewers

at home to understand the
crucial strategic decisions going
on inside the cockpit.
F1 Insights, powered by AWS.
(upbeat music)
